Uses of Class
filesystem.Directory

  • Packages that use Directory 
    Package Description
    filesystem  

    • Uses of Directory in filesystem

      Methods in filesystem that return Directory 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Directory Directory.createAndAddNewDir(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a given directory as a child of this directory if the directory does not already exist
      Directory Directory.getDirByName(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a child directory by name
      Directory FileSystem.getDirByPath(Path path)
      Provides directory located at given path to the caller
      Directory Directory.getParent()
      Gets the parent of this directory
      Directory FileSystem.getRoot()
      Getter for the root directory
      Directory FileSystem.getWorkingDir()
      Getter for the working directory
      Methods in filesystem with parameters of type Directory 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String FileSystem.getAbsolutePathOfDir(Directory theDir)
      Given a directory returns its absolute path
      Constructors in filesystem with parameters of type Directory 
      Constructor and Description
      Directory(java.lang.String name, Directory parent)
      Creates a new directory given the name of the directory and its parent
